content:
Can anyone please point me to an unsupported version of a project? ...need it for testing purposes for https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2714

[UX] Merge all the "Update core/module/theme/layout" pages into a single page. 路 Issue #2714 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
Describe your issue or idea Currently, in the "Available Updates report" page, the site admin can see which projects have updates, but the actions they can do are limited to a) downloadin...
I have two contrib modules that should be marked unsupported (one redesigned and the other just renamed). Is there a recipe for making this mark? Key / value in .info file?

@Vladimir you need to make a request either in https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues or here in Zulip, and one of the Bug Squad members or a b.org admin will mark the release as unsupported for you ...you can also request to set a major version as the recommended:

backdrop-ops/contrib
Apply to join the contributed code developer team. - backdrop-ops/contrib
image.png
...which projects/versions do you need to be marked as unsupported?

What exactly mean "unsupported"? In my case - discontinued because replaced with other module, in both README.md this status described from start.
https://backdropcms.org/project/base_meta
https://backdropcms.org/project/login_whitelist
Let me see what I can do...

How about this?:
image.png
image.png
Not sure. What should be done for? (I'm offline for 2 hours from now.)
@klonos , as I see you have already implemented your approach. But a link to README.md is very much needed in the message line to inform the user of an alternative at least.

Hello @Vladimir ...it's not "my" approach. All I've done is to mark these projects as unsupported in b.org. The warning shown is what is shown by Backdrop by default. ...I see what you mean though, but this would be a new feature: to allow unsupported Backdrop modules/themes/layouts to show a custom message instead.
That way message just scares a person without any valuable information. Not human friendly at all.
Yeah, I get that ...but this is the same message that Drupal shows for unsupported projects AFAIK. ...we aren't doing anything special/different in Backdrop ...but we should :smile:
Moreover, "Not secure" error sign it is not just a warning(and wrong in this case), it is call to action.
@klonos , please revert back your changes. This status message is completely wrong for existing users.
@klonos , any chance you seen my request?
Yup, ...I'll vert the changes now and will let you know when done.
...should be done now.
Thank you!
